files.patch:
@@ -95,1 +95,1 @@
-        JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(env,
+        JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(env,
@@ -109,1 +109,1 @@
-        JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(env,
+        JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(env,
@@ -192,1 +192,1 @@
-        JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(env,
+        JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(env,
@@ -254,1 +254,1 @@
-            JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(env,
+            JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(env,
@@ -277,1 +277,1 @@
-                JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(env,
+                JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(env,

@@ -98,3 +98,3 @@
- * Throw an exception by name, using the string returned by
- * getLastErrorString for the detail string. If the last-error
- * string is NULL, use the given default detail string.
+ * Throw an exception by name, using the C error string for the
+ * detail string. If the C error string is NULL, use the given
+ * default detail string. Is similar to C's strerror().
@@ -103,1 +103,1 @@
-JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(JNIEnv *env, const char *name,
+JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(JNIEnv *env, const char *name,
@@ -106,2 +106,3 @@
-    char buf[256];
-    size_t n = getLastErrorString(buf, sizeof(buf));
+    char* buf = NULL;
+    const int error = errno;
+    if (error != 0) buf = strerror(error);
@@ -109,1 +110,1 @@
-    if (n > 0) {
+    if (buf != NULL) {
@@ -125,2 +126,3 @@
- * Throw an exception by name, using a given message and a string
- * identical to one generated by perror() to construct the detail string.
+ * Throw an exception by name, using a given message and the C error
+ * string to construct the detail string. Is the equivalent of the
+ * C perror() for exceptions.
@@ -129,1 +131,1 @@
-JNU_PerrorThrowByNameWithMessage
+JNU_ThrowPerrorByNameWithMessage
@@ -135,1 +137,1 @@
-    int error = errno;
+    const int error = errno;
@@ -183,11 +185,0 @@
-/*
- * Convenience method.
- * Call JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError for java.io.IOException.
- */
-JNIEXPORT void JNICALL
-JNU_ThrowIOExceptionWithLastError(JNIEnv *env, const char *defaultDetail)
-{
-    JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(env, "java/io/IOException", defaultDetail);
-}
-
-

@@ -78,1 +78,1 @@
-JNU_ThrowByNameWithLastError(JNIEnv *env, const char *name,
+JNU_ThrowPerrorByName(JNIEnv *env, const char *name,
@@ -81,2 +81,4 @@
-/* Throw an exception by name, using a given message and a string
- * identical to one generated by perror() to construct the detail string.
+/*
+ * Throw an exception by name, using a given message and the C error
+ * string to construct the detail string. Is the equivalent of the
+ * C perror() for exceptions.
@@ -85,1 +87,1 @@
-JNU_PerrorThrowByNameWithMessage
+JNU_ThrowPerrorByNameWithMessage
@@ -88,3 +90,3 @@
-/* Throw an IOException, using the last-error string for the detail
- * string. If the last-error string is NULL, use the given default
- * detail string.
+/* Throw an IOException, using the error string from the currently failing
+ * IO operation for the detail string. If the IO error string is NULL, use
+ * the given default detail string.
@@ -93,1 +95,1 @@
-JNU_ThrowIOExceptionWithLastError(JNIEnv *env, const char *defaultDetail);
+JNU_ThrowIOExceptionWithIOError(JNIEnv *env, const char *defaultDetail);
@@ -343,0 +345,2 @@
+JNIEXPORT void JNICALL
+throwByNameWithWinError(JNIEnv *env, const char *name, const char *defaultDetail);
